title: From Stories to Strategy: Oral Histories as Qualitative Evidence for Neighborhood Planning
text:
Preface
Explain what this website will consist of. Acknowledgements.

title: Introduction
text: Explain inspiration for project. Provide context and explanation.

title: Computational Analysis
text: Overview of what quantitative analysis is, what tools used in R, and what measures were explored.

title: Metadata Analysis
text:
Spatial Metadata




All locations referenced in interviews pertaining to Jamaica, Queens, NY.




Location


N






Jamaica, Queens, NY


14 (87.50%)




Flushing, Queens, NY


3 (18.75%)




Forest Hills, Queens, NY


3 (18.75%)




Queens College, Queens, NY


3 (18.75%)




Manhattan, NY


2 (12.50%)




Jamaica Estates, Queens, NY


1 (6.25%)




Jamaica Hills, Queens, NY


1 (6.25%)






Count and Percentage shows the proportion of interviews where the location was mentioned. Example: Manhattan, NY appears in 13% of all interviews.




The following locations were each mentioned once:




Bronx locations: Hunts Point




Brooklyn locations: Bedford-Stuyvesant




Manhattan locations: Chelsea, Yorkville




Queens locations: Bayside, Douglaston, Flushing Meadows Corona Park, Forest Park, Fresh Meadows, Hillcrest, Hollis, Jackson Heights, Kew Gardens Hills, Ozone Park, Queens Village, Queensborough Community College, Richmond Hill, Ridgewood




Long Island locations: Commack, Roslyn




Other locations in the U.S.: Los Angeles, Rhode Island, Southern California, Southern Florida




Locations outside the U.S.: Czechoslovakia, Guyana, Istanbul

Count and percentage represent the proportion of Jamaica dialogue segments from interviewees occurring within a specific time period. For example, 47% of the segments reflect memories from the 1950s–1960s. The most recent memory dates back to 2023.

title: Qualitative Analysis
text: Overview of what qualitative analysis is, what tools used in R, and how data was explored and analyzed.

title: Applications
text: Discuss applications of oral history analysis in urban/neighborhood planning - tying back to the intro. Incorporate modern day data on themes discussed in oral histories.
